Framework

Protected constructor

public ~Framework();
Default destructor. Destroys all pointers used by Allegro.

clearBuffer

CreateAudioObject

public void CreateAudioObject( char* msg );
Creates an audio object reference for use by the API to stop and play audio files.
Parameters:
msg - The message that has been received from the module containing information needed for the function call.

CreateSprite

public void CreateSprite( char* msg );
Adds a new sprite object to the sprite handler based on information received via a message from the module.
Parameters:
msg - The message that has been received from the module containing information needed for the function call.

CreateSpriteRefDimensions

public void CreateSpriteRefDimensions( char* msg );
Adds a new sprite object to the sprite handler based on information received via a message from the module. This message does not contain width or height information. The sprite's width and height will be based on the associated bitmap file's loaded dimensions.
Parameters:
msg - The message that has been received from the module containing information needed for the function call.

CreateTextFromRef

public void CreateTextFromRef( char* msg );
Creates a new text object from a text asset reference in the XML file based on information received via a message from the module.
Parameters:
msg - The message that has been received from the module containing information needed for the function call.

CreateTextFromString

public void CreateTextFromString( char* msg );
Creates a new text object for a given text string based on information received via a message from the module.
Parameters:
msg - The message that has been received from the module containing information needed for the function call.

gameIsRunning

public bool gameIsRunning();
Returns the state (running or not running) of modules.
Returns:
true if a module is running, false otherwise

Instance

public static Framework* Instance( std::string );
Provides a pointer to the Singleton instance of the Framework class. If there is not an instance, it calls the constructor.
Parameters:
user - The username that the score of the game will be posted for.
Returns:
A pointer to the single Framework instance.

isActive

public bool isActive();
Returns the state (running or not running) of the Framework.
Returns:
true if the Framework loop is still running, false otherwise

KillSprite

public void KillSprite( char* msg );
Removes a specified sprite object from the sprite handler based on information received via a message from the module.
Parameters:
msg - The message that has been received from the module containing information needed for the function call.

LoadAudio

public void LoadAudio( std::string file_name, std::string gamePath );
Loads the audio assets from an XML file at the specified path and file name.
Parameters:
file_name - The path to the XML file relative to the module's EXE location.
gamePath - The path to the module's EXE location relative to the Framework's location.

LoadImages

public void LoadImages( std::string file_name, std::string gamePath );
Loads the image assets from an XML file at the specified path and file name.
Parameters:
file_name - The path to the XML file relative to the module's EXE location.
gamePath - The path to the module's EXE location relative to the Framework's location.

Loads the text assets from an XML file at the specified path and file name.
Parameters:
file_name - The path to the XML file relative to the module's EXE location.
gamePath - The path to the module's EXE location relative to the Framework's location.

ReadText

public void ReadText( char* msg );
Reads a string of text without displaying it to the screen. This does not create a text object.
Parameters:
msg - The message that has been received from the module containing information needed for the function call.
